alert.note: Alert for Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued December 25 at 1:02AM PST until December 27 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... ...FREEZING FOG ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Southwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 70 mph possible. * WHERE...Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties. * WHEN...From Monday evening through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...For the High Wind Watch, damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For the Freezing Fog Advisory, expect hazardous driving conditions due to poor visibility and potential frost on bridges, especially along US-395 between the Hallelujah Junction and Susanville.
info.instruction: Now is the time to secure loose outdoor items such as patio furniture, holiday decorations, and trash cans before winds increase which could blow these items away. The best thing to do is prepare ahead of time by making sure you have extra food and water on hand, flashlights with spare batteries and/or candles in the event of a power outage.
